attributes.action: cancel all aid payments to Sudan following the sentence handed out to English Teacher Gillian Gibbons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A British teacher has been found guilty in Sudan of insulting religion after she allowed her primary school class to name a teddy bear Muhammad. 

Gillian Gibbons, 54, from Liverpool, has been sentenced to 15 days in prison and will then be deported. 

Yet we continue to provide aid to a country that then treats naive people in such an astonishingly poor manner.

rejection.details:
Mrs Gibbons has now been released.

http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/stopsudanaid/
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
